definition: the Silk Road
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
(light) silk/CL:匹[pi3]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: It was a stopping point on the famous Silk Road between the East and the West .
sentences.chinese: 当时它是连接东西方的著名丝绸之路上的一个歇脚点。

sentences.english: About half of the road runs across Xinjiang.
sentences.chinese: “丝绸之路”约有一半的路段位于新疆内。

sentences.english: Many mummies have been found in the Silk Road.
sentences.chinese: 在丝绸之路发现了许多木乃伊。

sentences.english: It was not just merchandise, technology and culture that passed along the Silk Road .
sentences.chinese: 从丝绸之路而来的不仅是商品，工艺和文化。

sentences.english: The Silk Road always started from Loyang the ancient capital of China.
sentences.chinese: 丝绸之路一直是从中国的古都洛阳开始。

sentences.english: It's the conjunction of Europe and Asia, the end of the 'Silk Road'
sentences.chinese: 它是欧洲和亚洲的连接点，是丝绸之路之终点。

sentences.english: Kublai's kingdom was not only about the Silk Road over land.
sentences.chinese: 忽必烈时代不仅仅是只有“丝绸之路”。

sentences.english: The exploration of the South China Sea Silk Road began in the Western Han Peniod.
sentences.chinese: 南海丝绸之路的开辟，始于西汉时期。

sentences.english: Korla City has a long history of the ancient Silk Road routes throat.
sentences.chinese: 库尔勒市历史悠久，是古丝绸之路的咽喉要道。

sentences.english: Xi'an is the eastern end of the Silk Road .
sentences.chinese: 西安是丝绸之路的东端。

sentences.english: May be to the sea through the Silk Road in Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 可能是通过海上丝绸之路来到广州的。

sentences.english: The southern edge of Junggar Basin, is the The only access to the North Road of Silk Road.
sentences.chinese: 准噶尔盆地南缘，是丝绸之路北道的必经之地。

sentences.english: The silk road toward the west was opened by the Chinese in the 2nd century CE.
sentences.chinese: 公元二世纪，中国人开辟了通往西方的丝绸之路。

sentences.english: The China from Bijia Mountain had joined the Maritime Silk Road.
sentences.chinese: 笔架山窑的瓷器，已经加入到海上丝绸之路的行列。

sentences.english: The Silk Road was one of the most significant channels of civilizations in world history.
sentences.chinese: 在世界历史上，丝绸之路是最重要的文明渠道之一。

sentences.english: The camel was the major form of transportation tool on the ancient trade route during the Tang Dynasty .
sentences.chinese: 在古丝绸之路上，唐代的交通工具主要是骆驼。

definition: the Silk Road/abbr. for 絲綢之路|丝绸之路[Si1 chou2 zhi1 Lu4]
Hexi Corridor (or Gansu Corridor), a string of oases running the length of Gansu, forming part of the Northern Silk Road
Dunhuang county level city in Jiuquan 酒泉, Gansu
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Eurasian continent
Central Asia
Eurasia
old tea-horse market between Tibet, China, Southeast Asia and India, formalized as a state enterprise under the Song dynasty
Eurasian land bridge (rail line linking China and Europe)
Europe and Asia/Eurasia
Zhang Qian (-114 BC), Han dynasty explorer of 2nd century BC
Central Asian grasslands
Yumen Pass, or Jade Gate, western frontier post on the Silk Road in the Han Dynasty, west of Dunhuang, in Gansu
Samarkand, city in Uzbekistan
Dunhuang caves in Gansu/refers to Mogao caves 莫高石窟[Mo4 gao1 shi2 ku1]
old tea-horse road or southern Silk Road, dating back to 6th century, from Tibet and Sichuan through Yunnan and Southeast Asia, reaching to Bhutan, Sikkim, India and beyond
